note.p: Birth: Blackfriars, Bristol, Gloucestershire, England (22 January 1826)
Burial: Warstone Lane cemetery, Birmingham, Warwickshire

Career: Errand boy (age 12); apprenticed to a cooper (aged 17); moved to Birmingham (1851); Time Keeper, Soho works; Pracitioner in medical galvanism; Chemist to a phosporus factory; Head, Institute of Scientific Research, Birmingham (1880); Lecturer on Chemistry; wrote 'The art of electrometallurgy' (1877); received Civil List pension of £150 (1891); left £5,000 to the Royal Society and Royal Institution for 'assisting scientific discovery'
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1910-1911 vol 84 pp xxi-xxii signed by J H P
Notes: DNB and DSB give death date as 20 December 1908. F Crace Calvert has signed election certificate twice
